NationMania.ui

Class GameScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • NationMania.ui.GameScreen

  • public final class GameScreen
extends java.lang.Object
    Game Screen - holds all the information needed during a game. calls and manages the java core functions with threads

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Label[] Facts
      the list of facts to be showen
      static int hints
      the number keeping track of the number of facts used for this nation
      static Button mainMenu
      the other button showen after the game, for if the player is tired and wants to checks the high scores ***looks like home***
      static int MAX_NUM_FACTS
      used to initialize the fact array
      static javax.swing.JPanel panel
      parent panel for gamescreen components (added to card layout).
      static javax.swing.JProgressBar progressBar
      progress bar to show the user the time left for this game see GameTimer()
      static Button start
      the button the covers the screen after pressing "New Game", allows the user time to prepare before the timer is started ***looks like luggage***
      static Button tryAgain
      one of the two buttons showen imediately after the timer finishes.

    • Constructor Summary

      GameScreen()
      constructor - responasable for building components

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void displayInitialFacts()
      shows the two initial facts the user recieves for each nation
      static java.lang.Runnable initGame()
      pulls a new nation and reinitializes the board for a new round
      static void quit()
      prepares stuff to exit the game
      static void quitWithError()
      prepares stuff to exit the game with an error message
      static void setNewRound()
      returns control parameters for a fresh round and prepares the next nation
      static void startGame() 
      static void toggleEnable(boolean state)
      can both enable and disable all the screen buttons

      • Facts

        the list of facts to be showen

      • start

        public static Button start
        the button the covers the screen after pressing "New Game", allows the user time to prepare before the timer is started ***looks like luggage***

      • tryAgain

        public static Button tryAgain
        one of the two buttons showen imediately after the timer finishes. allows user another chance to maybe get a better score ***Nation Mania fun fact!*** it is costom in the finals of nm tournaments for the contestents to ask for up to two more trys*** (using this button). ***looks like luggage***

      • mainMenu

        public static Button mainMenu
        the other button showen after the game, for if the player is tired and wants to checks the high scores ***looks like home***

      • progressBar

        public static javax.swing.JProgressBar progressBar
        progress bar to show the user the time left for this game see GameTimer()

      • hints

        public static int hints
        the number keeping track of the number of facts used for this nation
